title: Paradox and Participation: Is the Holy Grail filled with the Truths that are No Longer Self-Evident?
description:
We look at the overlay between paradox and participation while discussing Owen Barfield in the context of the following:
Politics is downstream of culture.
Culture is downstream of communication.
Communication is downstream of language and meaning.

Meaning is the place we have to start if we are going to get the rest of it right.

Male and Female, the union and the differences, are at the heart of reality.
Our current disconnect between mind and body is a result of imaginative machinery which has lost its default setting.

Timestamp
0:00 Introduction
1:55 Chloe Valdary on Paradox
7:10 Participation
15:34 Ben Hur and Scene Setting
21:30 Trees and Our Imaginative Machinery
23:39 Michael's Big Announcement!
28:43 Michael's journey back to faith
33:20 Male Female Dynamic at the Heart of all Reality

The poem that was read at Michael's wedding:
In Defeat
Defeat may serve as well as victory
To shake the soul and let the glory out.
When the great oak is straining in the wind,
The boughs drink in new beauty, and the trunk
Sends down a deeper root on the windward side.
Only the soul that knows the mighty grief
Can know the mighty rapture. Sorrows come
To stretch out spaces in the heart for joy.
— Edwin Markham. 

"Redemption joins the suffering, beauty and joy in the world."
Michael Leighty

Chloe Valdary clip on paradox:
https://youtu.be/0cBS9SPG_rM?t=3134

Mark Vernon and John Vervaeke:
https://youtu.be/INz4dC7vVWQ

Owen Barfield's Saving the Appearances (A Study in Idolatry)
Iain McGilchrist's The Master and His Emissary (The Divided Brain
  and the Making of the Western World)
